bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Hannah Whitman Heyde, April 14, 1891
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

body.p: Am getting fairly on, considering—weather almost warm— Warry comes in advising me to try & get out a few minutes in the wheel chair (he to push it) — & I havn'thaven't give it up yet—But I am very feeble & listless yet & shall probably not—Dr Longaker here yesterday — he encourages me— roast apple for my breakfast, (a little 7 y'ryearold boy, friend of mine, bro'tbrought me two yesterday)—
Love to you, sister dear—$2 enc'denclosed—
